original_solution_mapping.L1: She has 24 students and her muffin recipe only makes 6 muffins so she needs to bake 24/6 = <<24/6=4>>4 batches of muffins
original_solution_mapping.L2: She brings muffins on the 1st of the month for 9 months and it takes 4 batches to feed all of her students so she bakes 9*4 = 36 batches of muffins

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3807.
    Returns: the total number of batches of muffins Georgia makes.
    """
    # L1
    num_students = 24 # 24 students
    muffins_per_batch = 6 # recipe only makes 6 muffins
    batches_per_month = num_students / muffins_per_batch

    # L2
    num_months = 9 # for 9 months
    total_batches = num_months * batches_per_month

    # FA
    answer = total_batches
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: She has {num_students} students and her muffin recipe only makes {muffins_per_batch} muffins so she needs to bake {num_students}/{muffins_per_batch} = <<{num_students}/{muffins_per_batch}={batches_per_month}>>{batches_per_month} batches of muffins

She brings muffins on the 1st of the month for {num_months} months and it takes {batches_per_month} batches to feed all of her students so she bakes {num_months}*{batches_per_month} = {total_batches} batches of muffins

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: She has 24 students and her muffin recipe only makes 6 muffins so she needs to bake 24/6 = <<24/6=4>>4 batches of muffins
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: She brings muffins on the 1st of the month for 9 months and it takes 9 batches to feed all of her students so she bakes 9*9 = 81 batches of muffins

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'num_months' (value: 9) was used instead of 'batches_per_month' (value: 4.0).
